resources.string: Do you have a passport with a biometric chip?
All UK passports have a biometric chip.\n\nIf you have a non-UK passport, it must have the biometric chip symbol on the cover.
The front cover of a passport with the biometric chip symbol. The symbol is rectangular with a circle in the middle.
You cannot use your passport if it has expired.
Read more about the types of photo ID you can use
Yes
No, use a different type of photo ID
Continue
Types of photo ID
You can use any of the following types of photo ID to prove your identity with the GOV.UK One Login app.
UK passport
You can use any UK passport if it has not expired.
The front cover of a British Passport with the biometric chip symbol. The symbol is rectangular with a circle in the middle.
Non-UK passport with a biometric chip
You can use a non-UK passport if it:
has a biometric chip
has not expired
To check if your passport has a biometric chip, look for the rectangular biometric chip symbol on the front cover.
The front cover of a passport with the biometric chip symbol. The symbol is rectangular with a circle in the middle.
UK biometric permit or card
This can be a:
biometric residence permit (BRP)
biometric residence card (BRC)
Frontier Worker permit (FWP)

You can use an expired BRP, BRC or FWP up to 18 months after its expiry date if you have a smartphone.\n\nFor example, if your BRP expired on 31 October 2024, you can use it to prove your identity until 30 April 2026.

An example of what a UK biometric permit or card looks like. It’s a pink and blue card with the UK government crest and the biometric chip symbol. The symbol is rectangular with a circle in the middle
UK photocard driving licence
You can use a UK driving licence if it:
is a plastic photocard, not a paper licence
has not expired
It can be a full or provisional UK driving licence.
An example of what a UK photocard driving licence looks like. It’s a pink and blue card with the UK flag.
